Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Adam J Gustavson was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 
44 days were granted if imposed.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Brookfield Police Dept. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
DAY REPORT CENTER - Consecutive to Huber sentence. No Good Time allowed at DRC. If defendant successfully completes the Day Report Program the 60 days of Stayed Huber will be permanently Stayed.

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid operator's license. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 60 Days are Straight Time. Balance with Huber. Release for work and treatment. Commencing forthwith. LAST 60 days of Huber are STAYED for compliance with the Day Report Center.
10/13/16 DEFENDANT IS DISCHARGED FROM ATC. TO SERVE THE REMAINDER OF SENTENCE. SENTENCE CREDIT OF 164 DAYS WERE GRANTED.
04/18/2017 DEFENDANT WAS PREVIOUSLY DISCHARGED FROM ATC ON 10/13/2016. ANY SENTENCE CREDIT FOR STAYED SENTENCE IMPOSED, TO BE AS STATED ON THE REVOCATION ORDER AND WARRANT FILED BY AGENT.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam J Gustavson in court, in custody, with Attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Ksicinski makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3  YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 44 days)
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

*D/L REVOCATION:  36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK:  36 months.

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed/sign releases.
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges).
*Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
*60 days of Day Report Center consecutive to condition time. 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation - to be forward to  Brookfield Police Department);

FINE:  $2,550.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted and remainder due as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME:  HUBER:  12 months, (1st 60 days straight time) -  then to be served as huber, then LAST 60 DAYS STAYED.  Release for work, treatment.  Defendant already in custody. 

DAY REPORT CENTER:  60 DAYS, Consecutive to Huber sentence.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 60 days of Huber stayed will be permanently stayed. 
 
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring. Defendant to post $750.00 cash and sign a $1000.00 signature bond.
